column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
2. You are approaching a railroad crossing and the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
column4: do what the approaching vehicle does.
column6: slow down and look for a train.
column8: stop and look for a train.
column10: look for a train, then speed up.

column2: 3. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column8: react as you would with a blowout.
column10: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.

column2: 4. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
5. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 6. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
column6: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.
column10: pedestrians are crossing at an intersection without a traffic light and without a crosswalk.

column2: 7. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column6: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column8: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.
column10: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 9. This road sign means:
10. Most signs used in street work areas are:
11. This road sign means:
12. If you miss your exit on a freeway, do NOT:
column4: continue on the freeway and find an alternative route.
column8: get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.

column2: 13. This sign means:
14. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
15. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.
column6: Texting a message on your cell phone.
column8: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column10: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.

column2: 16. To practice defensive driving you should:
column4: always leave yourself a way out.
column6: look well ahead of your vehicle and be aware of developing traffic situations around you.

column2: 17. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 18. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column6: only if the other driver signals it is safe.
column10: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.

column2: 19. This sign warns that:
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 20. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
21. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column6: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.
column8: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.

column2: 22. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 23. Warning signs normally are:
24. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column6: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
column8: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column10: you must stop again at the stop sign.

column2: 25. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
